clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy and Mechanism of DBS in VIC and NAcc for Refractory OCD
clinical_study.official_title: Deep Brain Stimulation for Refractory Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder: Efficacy and Mechanism of Ventral Internal Capsue and Nucleus Accumbens

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the efficacy and explore the mechanism of deep brain stimulation (DBS) in the ventral internal capsule (VIC) and nucleus accumbens (NAc) for refractory obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale (Y-BOCS) score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
primary_outcome.description: Y-BOCS is used to rate the severity of OCD symptoms by clinicians. Higher score means more severe OCD symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale-Self Report (Y-BOCS-SR) Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: The Y-BOCS-SR is a self-report version of the clinician-rated Y-BOCS. It consists of 10 items rated on a 5-point Likert scale (0 to 4) with higher scores denoting greater symptom severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Yale-Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale-Second Edition (Y-BOCS-II) Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: The Y-BOCS-II was created given several overarching concerns about the original Y-BOCS. Each item is rated from 0 to 5, and higher score means more severe OCD symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Obsessive-Compulsive Inventory - Revised (OCI-R) Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: The OCI-R is an 18-item self-reported scale that assesses the degree of distress caused by OCD symptoms. Each item is rated from "not at all" (codes as 0) to "extremely" (codes as 4), and three items constitute a subtype of OCD symptoms.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Hamilton Anxiety Scale Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: The Hamilton Anxiety Scale is a clinician-rated scale. Higher scores indicate more severe anxiety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Hamilton Depression Scale-17 Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: The Hamilton Depression Scale-17 is a clinician-rated scale. Higher scores indicate more severe depression.
The MRI images contains resting, multi-tasks related, and structural states.
The CANTAB software research is used to assess memory and learning. The tasks incude spatial working memory task, paired associated learning task, pattern recognition memory task.
The computerized tasks are used to measure impulsivity and compulsivity. The tasks include stop single task, beads task, model-based modle-free task and habit task.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Young Manic Rating Scale(YMRS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: The YMRS is a 11-item rating scale used to evaluate manic symptoms. Higher score indicates more severe mania.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: The 36-Item Short Form Survey (SF-36) is used to measure the quality of life. The higher score means higher quality of life.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: The WHOQOL-BREF is used to measure the quality of life. The higher score means higher quality of life.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: The quality of life enjoyment and satisfaction questionnaire - short form (Q-LES-Q-SF) is used to measure the quality of life. The higher score means higher quality of life.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: The pittsburgh sleep quality index (PSQI) is used to measure the quality and patterns of sleep. Higher score means poorer quality of sleep.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: The perceived stress scale (PSS-10) is used to measure stress levels and contains 10 items rated from "never" (coded as 0) to "very often" (coded as 4). Higher score means higher level of stress.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: The positive and negative affective schedule (PANAS) consists of 20 words that describe different feeling and emotions. 10 words constitute negative affect and positive affect subscales. Each word was rated from "very slightly or not at all" (coded as 1) to "extremely" (coded as 5). Higher score means higher level of positive or negative affect.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (preoperative), 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: The Sheehan Disability Scale is a composite of three self-rated items designed to measure the extent to which three major sectors in the patient's life are impaired. The patient rates the extent to which his or her 1) work, 2) social life or leisure activities, and 3) home life or family responsibilities are impaired by his or her symptoms on a 10-point visual analog scale.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Bilateral surgical implantation of DBS system
arm_group.description: All the participants will receive bilateral surgical implantation of DBS system to VIC and NAc. The experimenter will active the DBS system and adjust the parameters for all the participants after surgery.

intervention.description: The DBS device utilized in the present study includes a dual-channel neurostimulator kit, lead kit, extension kit, clinician-operated wireless programmer, test stimulator, and patient controller. The lead contains four stimulating contacts. The length of each contact is 1.5 mm, and the spacing between contacts is 1.5 mm. The participants will receive stepwise surgery. The electrodes will be implanted firstly which will be externalized for several days and then the IPG will be implanted. During externalization, the experimenters will record the local field potential and electroencephalography in resting or task-based state with conditions of sham-stimulation or active-stimulation.
